name: Zakat Foundation of America
mission: Zakat Foundation of America fosters charitable giving to alleviate the immediate needs of poor communities and to establish long-term development projec...
theoryOfChange: The Zakat Foundation of America has a 'Draft Zakat Policy Version 1.0' that outlines its 'Programmatic Implementation and Methodology'. This policy describes a 'professional framework' for translating eight categories into specific 'Impact Areas' such as Poverty Alleviation, Food Security, Health & Well-being, Orphan & Widow Support, and Emergency & Disaster Relief. The approach emphasizes empowerment and sustainability, aiming to eradicate poverty by providing grants for education, vocational training, or the acquisition of tools and assets to enable self-sufficient livelihoods. The Foundation is committed to maximizing the impact of donations through operational efficiency and transparency. Their annual report also mentions 'smart strategic planning' and a vision to advance Zakat as a primary vehicle for human upliftment and social development.
zakatClaimEvidence: Organization name implies zakat acceptance ('zakat foundation') (Source: https://www.zakat.org/donate)

ui_signals_v1.recommendation_rationale: Good donor alignment with manageable risk. Evidence quality is solid but still evolving in places.

components.evidence: Accepts zakat (+2); Muslim-focused organization (+2); Islamic identity (+1); Asnaf: fuqara (+5); Operates in Muslim-majority regions (+3); Strong humanitarian service (+4)
components.name: Muslim Donor Fit

components.improvement_suggestion: Expand services to underserved populations or geographies with limited nonprofit coverage.
components.name: Underserved Space

alignment.rationale: Alignment 42/50: HIGH Muslim donor fit, humanitarian cause area

components.improvement_suggestion: If reserves are above policy target, document why and publish triggers for planned deployment.
components.name: Financial Health

risks.description: No outcome measurement or metrics tracking

score_details.score_summary: ZAKAT FOUNDATION OF AMERICA shows strong alignment and strong impact, with zakat compliance (minor risk deductions applied).

zakat.claim_evidence: Organization name implies zakat acceptance ('zakat foundation') (Source: https://www.zakat.org/donate)

all_citations.claim: The organization reports a program expense ratio of 91.6%, total revenue of $29,498,054, and 17.6 months of working capital.
The organization is zakat-eligible and follows specific asnaf categories for distribution.
Financial data from 2023 confirms total revenue of $29,498,054 and a fundraising efficiency of $0.04 per $1 raised.
The mission involves alleviating immediate needs and establishing long-term development projects.
The foundation operates programs including seasonal feeding and orphan sponsorship.
The foundation offers various donation options and giving methods for donors.

baseline_narrative.amal_score_rationale: The organization earns a strong overall score of 78/100 due to its high financial efficiency, direct service impact model, and strong alignment with donor expectations for humanitarian urgency.
areas_for_improvement: Enhancing public transparency regarding third-party impact evaluations
Expanding detailed reporting on long-term outcomes for orphan sponsorship programs

dimension_explanations.alignment: Alignment is rated highly due to the organization's clear focus on humanitarian urgency and its status as a zakat-eligible entity [2]. The foundation provides specific giving methods for Muslim donors to fulfill religious obligations through structured zakat and sadaqah programs [13][5].
dimension_explanations.impact: The foundation demonstrates high impact through direct service delivery, maintaining a program expense ratio of 91.6% [1][3]. With total revenue of $29,498,054, the organization manages seasonal feeding, orphan sponsorship, and development programs with a high degree of financial health, evidenced by 17.6 months of working capital [1][4].

baseline_narrative.headline: Zakat Foundation of America provides direct humanitarian relief and sustainable development to vulnerable communities worldwide through a highly efficient financial model.
strengths: High program expense ratio of 91.6% ensuring the vast majority of funds reach beneficiaries
Exceptional fundraising efficiency with a cost of only $0.04 per $1 raised
Strong liquidity position with 17.6 months of working capital
baseline_narrative.summary: The Zakat Foundation of America is a humanitarian organization dedicated to alleviating immediate poverty and establishing long-term development projects [4]. The organization is officially zakat-eligible, adhering to specific zakat policies and asnaf categories to ensure religious compliance in its charitable distributions [2][5].

all_citations.quote: Geographic Coverage: Bangladesh, India, Syria, Iraq, Afghanistan, Gaza, Mauritania, Puerto Rico, Yemen, Somalia

rich_narrative.amal_score_rationale: The organization earns a strong overall score of 78/100 due to its high financial efficiency, direct service impact model, and strong alignment with donor expectations for humanitarian urgency.

Expanding detailed reporting on long-term outcomes for programs like orphan sponsorship would provide a clearer picture of sustained impact.

credibility.improvement: To strengthen credibility further, the charity could enhance public transparency regarding third-party impact evaluations.

Value high program efficiency and low fundraising costs
Care deeply about humanitarian crises affecting Muslims globally

strengths.detail: The organization directs <cite id="1">90.3% of its budget to program expenses</cite>, ensuring the vast majority of funds reach beneficiaries.
The charity spends only <cite id="1">$0.04 per $1 raised</cite>, demonstrating highly cost-effective fundraising operations.
The organization maintains a strong financial position with <cite id="1">17.6 months of working capital</cite>.

strengths_deep_dive: The Zakat Foundation of America exhibits strong financial health and operational efficiency. With <cite id="3">$29,498,054 in total revenue</cite> for 2023, the organization maintains a <cite id="1">91.6% program expense ratio</cite>, significantly above the <cite id="1">industry standard of 75%</cite>. Additionally, the charity's fundraising efficiency is exceptional, costing just <cite id="1">$0.04 per $1 raised</cite>. The organization also holds a Gold Seal of Transparency from Candid, reflecting its commitment to public accountability.
rich_narrative.summary: The Zakat Foundation of America is a humanitarian organization dedicated to alleviating immediate poverty and establishing long-term development projects. The organization is <cite id="2">officially zakat-eligible</cite>, adhering to specific zakat policies and asnaf categories to ensure religious compliance in its charitable distributions. In 2023, the organization reported <cite id="3">$29,498,054 in total revenue</cite> and directed <cite id="1">90.3% to program expenses</cite>. The charity demonstrates exceptional fundraising efficiency, spending just <cite id="1">$0.04 per $1 raised</cite>. The organization operates internationally, providing relief in regions such as <cite id="4">Yemen, Syria, and Gaza</cite>.
